edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.Map
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents the game's map and all of the Entity objects contained within.
    Author:
    Natanael Ariawan, David Hau, Miguel Menjivar, Aidan Novobilski
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Map.moveResult
      This enumeration represents all of the possible outcomes of the movement of the player.

      This method reduces the player's life and also repositions enemies if there exists any number of enemies within the player's spawn area, the 3 by 3 block area at the bottom left of the world.

      This method reduces the number of turns the player has left to be invincible when the player has picked up an invincibility item and has turns of invincibility remaining.

      This method ensures that an item can only be used once, and is called after resolving an item's use.

      This method resolves the item effect of an item when an item is picked up by the player in the method, movePlayer(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.UI.direction), based on the type of item that was picked up by the player.

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        This field represents the unique ID used for saving and loading via serialization.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • gameMap

        private Entity[][] gameMap
        This field represents the game's map, and the locations of every entity within the game world.

      • rand

        private java.util.Random rand
        This field represents the random number generator used in determining random outcomes.

      • previousPlayerRow

        private int previousPlayerRow
        This field is used in keeping track of the player's row prior to moving. This field is used in order to replace the player back in their original position if the player is unable to move. In addition, this field is also partly used in determining the AI movement of the enemy in the method, moveAI().

      • previousPlayerColumn

        private int previousPlayerColumn
        This field is used in keeping track of the player's column prior to moving. This field is used in order to replace the player back in their original position if the player is unable to move. In addition, this field is also partly used in determining the AI movement of the enemy in the method, moveAI().

      • playerRow

        private int playerRow
        This field represents the player's current row. This field can be altered when the player moves through the method, movePlayer(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.UI.direction) and is used to determine where the player is at all times. This is useful for when the player {look(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.UI.direction, int)s or shoot(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.UI.direction)s.

      • playerColumn

        private int playerColumn
        This field represents the player's current column. This field can be altered when the player moves through the method, movePlayer(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.UI.direction) and is used to determine where the player is at all times. This is useful for when the player {look(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.UI.direction, int)s or shoot(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.UI.direction)s.

      • lastItem

        private Item.itemType lastItem
        This field represents the type of the last item that the player picked up. If this field is not null, then the item will be resolved by the method, resolveItem(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.Item.itemType), and be reset to null by the method, resetLastItem().

      • turnsInvincible

        private int turnsInvincible
        This field represents the number of turns the player has remaining to be invincible. This item is set to a value of 6 in the method, resolveItem(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.Item.itemType), when the player picks up an invincibility item. This value is automatically reduced on the first turn, ensuring that the player only has 5 turns of invincibility. Then, the value of this field will be reduced once every turn. While this field contains a value greater than 0, the method, {enemyScan(), will not be called, giving the player a "pseudo invincibility".

      • debug

        private boolean debug
        This field represents whether or not the game is in "debug mode". This field is initialized when a game is first initialized by the GameEngine through the method, initialize(boolean, boolean, boolean, int)} and can never be altered.

      • hardMode

        private boolean hardMode
        This field represents whether or not the game is in "hard mode". This field is initialized when a game is first initialized by the GameEngine through the method, initialize(boolean, boolean, boolean, int)} and can never be altered.

      • godMode

        private boolean godMode
        This field represents whether or not the game is in "God mode". This field is initialized when a game is first initialized by the GameEngine through the method, initialize(boolean, boolean, boolean, int)} and can never be altered.

      • level

        private int level
        This field represents the current level the player is on. This field is initialized to 1 when a game is first initialized by the GameEngine through the method, initialize(boolean, boolean, boolean, int) and is increased in increments of 1 when the method, nextLevel(int), is called.

      • numOfTurns

        private int numOfTurns
        This field represents the number of turns the player has taken on the specific level that the player is currently on. This field is only increased after the player moves through the method, movePlayer(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.UI.direction)}.

      • totalNumOfTurns

        private int totalNumOfTurns
        This field represents the total number of turns the player has taken prior to the current level. The field numOfTurns is only added to this field when the player decides to move onto the next level by calling the method, nextLevel(int).

      • roomsChecked

        private int roomsChecked
        This field represents the number of rooms the player has checked on the specific level that the player is currently on. This field is only increased when the player checks a room in the method, movePlayer(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.UI.direction).

      • totalRoomsChecked

        private int totalRoomsChecked
        This field represents the total number of rooms the player has checked prior to the current level. The field roomsChecked is only added to this field when the player decides to move onto the next level by calling the method, nextLevel(int).

      • itemPickups

        private int itemPickups
        This field represents the number of items the player has obtained on the specific level that the player is currently on. This field is only increased when the player obtains an item in the method, movePlayer(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.UI.direction).

      • totalItemPickups

        private int totalItemPickups
        This field represents the total number of items the player has obtained prior to the current level. The field itemPickups is only added to this field when the player decides to move onto the next level by calling the method, nextLevel(int).

      • enemiesKilled

        private int enemiesKilled
        This field represents the number of enemies the player has killed on the specific level that the player is currently on. This field is only increased when the player kills an enemy in the method, shoot(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.UI.direction).

      • totalEnemiesKilled

        private int totalEnemiesKilled
        This field represents the total number of enemies the player has killed prior to the current level. The field enemiesKilled is only added to this field when the player decides to move onto the next level by calling the method, nextLevel(int).

      • score

        private int score
        This field represents the player's current score. This field is first initialized as 0 in the method, initialize(boolean, boolean, boolean, int) and is only updated when the tallyScore(boolean) method is called based on the different circumstances.

      • modeMultiplier

        private double modeMultiplier
        This field represents the score multiplier associated with each mode. This field is initialized in the method, initialize(boolean, boolean, boolean, int), based on the mode that the player is playing in and can never be changed.

      • levelMultiplier

        private double levelMultiplier
        This field represents the score multiplier associated with the current level. This field is initialized as 1 in the method, initialize(boolean, boolean, boolean, int), and is increased by 0.5 for each level after level 1 through the method, nextLevel(int).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        public Map()
        This constructor method initializes the random object assigned to the field, rand, in order to be used as a random number generated for random events.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(boolean debug,
                       boolean hardMode,
                       boolean godMode,
                       int maxAmmo)
        This method first assigns proper values to the fields debug, hardMode, and godMode based on the parameters given. In addition, this method also sets proper values to each of the fields involving game stats, score, and multipliers. Then, this method initializes and places all Entity objects necessary within the game map ((0, 0) being the top left corner and (8, 8) being the bottom right corner), where the number of enemies placed is dictated by the level.
        Parameters:
        debug - true if in debug mode, false otherwise
        hardMode - true if in hard mode, false otherwise
        godMode - true if in God mode, false otherwise
        maxAmmo - an int representing the maximum ammo of the player based on the current magazine upgrade of the Shop in the GameEngine

      • nextLevel

        public void nextLevel(int gainLife)
        This method first updates all of the fields involving game stats, scores, and multipliers accordingly. Then, this method creates a new game world with randomly placed entities and takes the player from the previous game world and re-places that same player object in the same starting position as the previous game world.
        Parameters:
        gainLife - an int representing the number of lives gained when moving onto the next level, which is determined by the current health upgrade of the Shop through the GameEngine

      • placeRooms

        private void placeRooms()
        This method will generate the nine rooms and randomly add the briefcase to one of them. It will then add the rooms into the map. If #debug is true, the room with the briefcase will be visible.

      • placeEnemies

        private void placeEnemies(int numOfEnemies)
        This method will generate the six Enemy objects, and place them within the game world. If debug is true, then the enemies will be visible.
        Parameters:
        numOfEnemies - the number of enemies to be randomly placed

      • placeItems

        private void placeItems()
        This method will generate the three Item objects, and place them within the game world. If debug is true, then the items will be visible.

      • placeRandomly

        private void placeRandomly(Entity entity)
        This method will generate a random position, and if it is unoccupied, it will place the given entity in that position. This method also ensures that no entity, whether enemy or item, can be placed within the spawning area of the player, the 3 by 3 block area at the bottom left of the world.
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to be placed

      • look

        public int look(UI.direction dir,
                int distance)
        This method allows the player to look in a certain direction to check whether or not there are enemies in the direction that the player looks. The player initially can only look 2 tiles in front of them. However, this feature can be upgraded in the Shop through the GameEngine. This method then returns an integer value representing the distance from the player to the first enemy in their line of sight that is within the vision limits. If the player does not see any enemies, is looking at a wall, or is looking at a room, this method will return 0.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction the player wants to look at
        distance - an int representing how far the player's vision can see
        Returns:
        an int representing the distance between and the first enemy in their line of sight or 0 if no enemies were found

      • shoot

        public boolean shoot(UI.direction dir)
        This method will "fire" a bullet from the player's position, and remove the first enemy it encounters from the map.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction the player wants to shoot
        Returns:
        true if the shot hits, false otherwise

      • movePlayer

        public Map.moveResult movePlayer(UI.direction dir)
        This method attempts to move the player in the direction specified by the player. The attempt will only be successful if the space the player is trying move to is either null or is an item. Then, the type of the result from the attempt to move will be returned. From this information, the GameEngine will be able to tell whether the player has moved or hasn't moved and the reason for the action that's been made.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction the player wants to move
        Returns:
        the type of result from the attempt to move in the given direction

      • returnPlayerToStart

        public void returnPlayerToStart()
        This method returns the player to the coordinates (8, 0), which is the player's starting position, and calls the method, playerLostLife(), when the player is on a tile next to a ninja at the start of the enemies' turn.

      • playerLostLife

        private void playerLostLife()
        This method reduces the player's life and also repositions enemies if there exists any number of enemies within the player's spawn area, the 3 by 3 block area at the bottom left of the world.

      • setMaxAmmo

        public void setMaxAmmo(int maxAmmo)
        This method sets the player's max ammo when the game is initialized based on the current magazine upgrade in the Shop. This method is only called once in the method, initialize(boolean, boolean, boolean, int), and the player's max ammo is never changed afterwards.
        Parameters:
        maxAmmo - an int that represents the player's designated max ammo based on the magazine upgrade in the Shop

      • resolveItem

        public void resolveItem(Item.itemType type)
        This method resolves the item effect of an item when an item is picked up by the player in the method, movePlayer(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.UI.direction), based on the type of item that was picked up by the player.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of item picked up by the player

      • resetLastItem

        public void resetLastItem()
        This method ensures that an item can only be used once, and is called after resolving an item's use.

      • reduceTurnsInvincible

        public void reduceTurnsInvincible()
        This method reduces the number of turns the player has left to be invincible when the player has picked up an invincibility item and has turns of invincibility remaining.

      • enemyScan

        public boolean enemyScan()
        This method allows every enemy on the map to scan the four adjacent spaces around them. If a player is on a space adjacent to any ninja on the map, this method will return true, otherwise this method will return false.
        Returns:
        true if the player is next to a ninja, false otherwise

      • enemyMove

        public void enemyMove()
        This method moves the ninja in one of four random directions. This method first scans the spaces around the ninja to check which directions are available for the ninja to move to. Then, this method takes the available directions and equally chooses one of the available directions and moves the ninja in that direction. If no directions are available, then the ninja will remain in the same spot.

      • moveAI

        public void moveAI()
        This method moves the ninja according to an AI. This method first checks the available directions, just as in the method, enemyMove(). Then, this method checks which direction(s) are preferred by the ninja, if one or two directions were to be chosen so that the ninja approaches the player, and compares those directions to the available directions to see which possible directions the ninja would move in if it was to seek the player. Then, the choice between whether the ninja seeks the player or is moved randomly is randomized, with the chance of seeking increased the farther away the ninja is from the player. If seeking fails, then a direction is randomly chosen from the available directions. If seeking succeeds but there are no possible directions the ninja could move in order to seek the player, then the ninja is moved in whatever direction is available. If there are no directions available, then the ninja will remain in the same spot.

      • tallyScore

        public void tallyScore(boolean win)
        This method adds the current level's score onto the overall score. The score calculated differs on whether the condition is that the player cleared the level, in which extra points are added, or whether the condition is that the player lost before the level was cleared, in which the level clear points are not added.
        Parameters:
        win - true if the player cleared the level, false otherwise

      • getMap

        public Entity[][] getMap()
        Returns the map of the game as a 2D array of entities.
        Returns:
        the game map

      • getPlayerLives

        public int getPlayerLives()
        This method retrieves the number of lives the player currently has.
        Returns:
        an int that represents the player's lives

      • getAmmo

        public int getAmmo()
        This method retrieves the number of bullets the player currently has.
        Returns:
        an int that represents the player's ammo

      • getMaxAmmo

        public int getMaxAmmo()
        This method retrieves the number of bullets the player's gun can hold.
        Returns:
        an int that represents the player's max ammo

      • getTurnsInvincible

        public int getTurnsInvincible()
        This method retrieves the number of turns that the player has to be invincible.
        Returns:
        an int that represents the player's remaining number of turns to be invincible

      • getLastItem

        public Item.itemType getLastItem()
        This method retrieves the type of item that was last picked up by the player.
        Returns:
        the type of item last picked up by the player

      • getLevel

        public int getLevel()
        This method retrieves the current level the player is on.
        Returns:
        an int that represents the current level

      • getNumOfTurnsScore

        public int getNumOfTurnsScore()
        This method calculates the points given when a level is cleared based on how many turns have elapsed.
        Returns:
        an int that represents the score for the level clear

      • getLivesRemainingScore

        public int getLivesRemainingScore()
        This method calculates the points given for the number of lives the player has remaining.
        Returns:
        an int that represents the score for the player's remaining lives

      • getRoomsCheckedScore

        public int getRoomsCheckedScore()
        This method calculates the points given for the number of rooms the player checked.
        Returns:
        an int that represents the score for the number of rooms the player checked

      • getItemPickupsScore

        public int getItemPickupsScore()
        This method calculates the points given for the number of items the player obtained.
        Returns:
        an int that represents the score for the number of items the player obtained

      • getEnemiesKilledScore

        public int getEnemiesKilledScore()
        This method calculates the points given for the number of enemies the player killed.
        Returns:
        and int that represents the score for the number of enemies the player killed

      • getLevelScore

        public int getLevelScore()
        This method calculates the total score for the current level only if the player has cleared the level.
        Returns:
        an int that represents the player's total score for the level

      • getTotalNumOfTurns

        public int getTotalNumOfTurns()
        This method returns the value of the field totalNumOfTurns plus the value of the field numOfTurns in order to get the overall number of turns the player has taken.
        Returns:
        an int that represents the total number of turns the player has taken

      • getTotalRoomsChecked

        This method returns the value of the field totalRoomsChecked plus the value of the field roomsChecked in order to get the overall number of rooms the player has checked.
        Returns:
        an int that represents the total number of rooms the player has checked

      • getTotalItemPickups

        public int getTotalItemPickups()
        This method returns the value of the field getTotalItemPickups() plus the value of the field itemPickups in order to get the overall number of items the player has obtained.
        Returns:
        an int that represents the total number of items the player has obtained

      • getTotalEnemiesKilled

        public int getTotalEnemiesKilled()
        This method returns the value of the field getTotalEnemiesKilled() plus the value of the field enemiesKilled in order to get the overall number of enemies the player has killed.
        Returns:
        an int that represents the total number of enemies the player has killed

        This method retrieves the value of the final score to be printed in the method, UI.printGameOver(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, String[]).
        Returns:
        an int that represents the player's final score
